content.description:
The first pitch follows the main slash up and left past 9 bolts to a bolted anchor.  The rock is so-so and the crux could be a combination of grain and a legitimate move or two right near the top.

The second pitch is more like 3 stars.  It busts out onto the face on better rock and follows nice edges and 9 bolts (with some possible runouts) to the top of the formation.  Bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: This is the big slash leading up and left that splits the main formation.  Bolt anchors and a single rope rap.

content.description: Takes the obvious line on the left side of the pillar.  Rock is fair to ok.... Be sure to move right for the last pitch or so along the ramp that breaks the summit.
content.location: This is the left side of the giant pillar and corner system on the left end of the wall.  Slabby start into the the left facing dihedral.  Walk off/scramble to climbers left.

content.description:
Pitch 1:  Use the Busy Child start and then exit the chimney to the right, to a bolted anchor.

Pitch 2:  Follow the left slanting and somewhat grainy crack to bolted anchors.

Pitch 3:  Clip a couple of bolts and join the last pitch of Wall Of Separation to the summit anchors.
content.protection: Gear to 3" and bolts.  Bolted anchors all the way.
content.location: Start in Busy Child and half way up the chimney look for a bolted circus move that will take you out of the chimney to the right.  Bolted anchors, single rope rap.

climbs.name: King Of Croatia
climbs.fa: undone, tried by Russ Walling, Mick Ryan, Bruce Pottenger

content.description: The crux is the upper choss of this big corner.  The bolt is suspect and the rock is probably worse.  Numerous grating falls await the bold lead who ventures out on this one.  So far there has been some 5.10 climbing done above the bolt.... but then the grains took over.... Best of luck!
content.protection: Fair nuts or cams until you get to the bad bolt.  Joins the anchor of Slab Hymen if you get that far.
content.location: This route takes the right side of the obvious pillar.  It is a big stepped roofy looking thing.  Rap using the Slab Hymen anchors if you get that far.

content.description:
First pitch:  Technical slab with some very insecure moves at mid-height.  Get your best friction boots out for this one.  A nice crisp day will make the numerous high steps and rockovers seem only very dicey.

Second pitch: Follow bolts and possible runout sections to the top of the crag.
content.protection:
First Pitch: 10 Bolts to a bolt anchor.

Second Pitch: Bolts to the top of the formation.  Bolt anchor.
content.location:
First pitch:  Start in the shallow left facing corner to the right of "German People".

Second Pitch:  Uses the the shared anchor of Wall Of Separation.  Continue up the bolted line (possibly runout slightly) to the top of the formation.  Single rope rap using whatever bolted stations look like they might get you down.

climbs.name: Do Not Take The German People Lightly I Say

content.description: Well protected slab climbing on good rock.  The start is slicker than the rest of the route.
content.location: This route is in the middle of the face, between Slab Hymen on the left, and the opening corner of Forbidden Dance.

content.description: Start in the chimney and work your way up a left leaning toothy crack that eventually goes to hand size.  Slightly burley, but all there with good pro.  Crux is midway at a slight bulge.
content.location: Starts in the big chimney on the right side of the main face.  Bolted anchor at the top of the pitch.

content.description: This route might be the best on the crag and a must do.  The opening crux will immediately test your friction skills.  If you can stick the opening sequence, you have it made... as long as you are comfortable with some healthy runouts on 5.7 ground.  Good edges lead all the way to the top with a nice mini-crux right before the anchors.  The second pitch is not as good as the first, but you are here already... might as well do it.
content.protection:
Pitch 1: 5.9 R (Bolts to bolt anchors.)

Pitch 2: 5.10b (Bolts to bolt anchors.)
content.location: Slab Hymen is the first route to the right of the big corner that is King Of Croatia.  You can do a single rope rap and if you plan it right, string the anchors of "German People" on the way down to top rope that route.
